title: The loyal and true hearted subjects good will to King and Common-wealth. For all the merchants that with lead doth trade, and minors, I these verses here have made, for their sweet pleasure mirth, and great delight, I took the pains these verses to indite, but my good will to King and country here to all true subjects plainly shall appear. To the tune of, The Dukes wish, or Ile ask no more.
author: Houghton, Thomas, Gent.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for Thomas Passenger at the three bibles on London-bridge,
